Create run chart with highlighted improvements where applicable

Source: R/runcharter_facet.R
runcharter_facet.Rd

This will plot the original dataframe, with highlighted runs of improvement. It will also return a dataframe showing the improvment data

runcharter_facet(df, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9,
  chart_title = NULL, chart_subtitle = NULL, direction = "below",
  faceted = TRUE, facet_cols = NULL, ...)

Arguments

df

dataframe containing columns "date", "y", "grp"
med_rows

the number of rows you wish to base the initial median calculation over
runlength

how long a run of consecutive points should be before re-basing the median
chart_title

title for the final chart
chart_subtitle

subtitle for chart
direction

look for runs "below" or "above" the median
faceted

whether the plot is faceted or not - must be TRUE to call this function
facet_cols

the number of columns to facet by
...

further arguments passed on to function

Value

runchart and a dataframe showing sustained run data if appropriate

Examples

runcharter_facet(data, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9, chart_title = "Automated runs analysis",
direction = "above")
#> Error in runcharter_facet(data, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9, chart_title = "Automated runs analysis",     direction = "above"): could not find function "runcharter_facet"
